message: Hello Bob, I have a great product that I think you'll love. I'm willing to let it go for $120.
I'm interested in the product, but $120 is a bit steep for me. I'd be willing to pay $90 for it.
I understand you're looking for a better deal, Bob. I can meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit. I'm willing to sell the product for $110.
I appreciate you meeting me halfway, but I was thinking more along the lines of $95. Can you consider that?
I can see you're serious about getting a good deal, Bob. I'm willing to compromise a bit further, but I need to make a decent profit. I can sell the product for $105.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I was thinking more along the lines of $98. Can you consider that?
I'm starting to think we're getting close, Bob. I'm willing to meet you at $99, but that's as low as I'm willing to go.
I'm getting close to your price, but I'd love to get it down to $97. Can you consider that?
I'm not willing to go any lower than $99, Bob. That's my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to consider other options.
I understand you're not willing to go any lower than $99, but I'm willing to meet you at $98. That's my final offer.
